item.title: The Cutting Edge of Common Sense; why businesses fail to follow Google's example
item.description: Google is namedropped when somebody wants to demonstrate success, innovation or an overwhelmingly positive work environment (we’ll save toxic echo chamber algorithms for another day). The name of the company has become a buzzword for marrying financial success with employee satisfaction; ‘Googles strategy for happy employees boosts it’s bottom line’. It shouldn’t be a surprise to anyone. In an increasingly globalised world, many companies have good ideas, but the company with the best people is going to come out on top.
